Issues.Title: '-' or '_' ?
Issues.Body:
I find some file in this repo named using '-', like `angular/packages/bazel/src/ng_package/collect-type-definitions.bzl`, and in the same folder I find another style using '_', like `angular/packages/bazel/src/ng_package/ng_package.bzl`.

I think those Naming conventions should be unified, right ?

Issues.Title: add casted control getters
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
`@angular/forms`

### Description
Currently `get` on AbstractControl returns an `AbstractControl`. This works as intended but dosen't play well with `strictTemplates` and deeply nested forms.

### Describe the solution you'd like
add the methosd `getGroup` `getControl` `getArray` which will run the `get` function but then cast the type and do a runtime check to ensure it's the correct runtime type also.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Put a method in your component class, but this isn't ergonomic
```
asControl(c: AbstractControl): FormControl { return c as FormControl }
```

Happy to submit a patch
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "add casted control getters" (#36405)

Issues.Title: add Promise<T> | Observable<T> async pipe overload
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
`@angular/common`

### Description
Currently the async pipe can take a Promise or Observable, but only as seperate obverloads, so with `strictTemplates` you get an error if you pass in a `Promise<T> | Observable<T>`

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add an overload which looks like `transform<T>(obj: Promise<T> | Observable<T> | null | undefined): T | null;`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
converting the promise into a observable, but this isn't ergonomic


Happy to submit a patch
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "add Promise<T> | Observable<T> async pipe overload" (#36404)

Issues.Title: Inline CSS from Angular Animations lost when reattaching Route Snapshot
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/animations
@angular/router

### Is this a regression?
Behavior started with angular 9

### Description
When using a Custom Route Reuse strategy the css that had been applied via an angular animation disappears leaving the element in neither "animation state"


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://github.com/IanNMarshall/angular9-animations-example

#### Steps to reproduce
```
$ ng serve
```
1. Click the "animation" button to be routed to /animation 
2. Toggle the animation any number of times or none at all
3. Click home to navigate away
4. Click "animation" again and the animation css has been removed, it is in neither the open or closed state.
5. Additionally if you now toggle the animation it works for all future routing

#### Working example
Same src as above example but pre angular 9, works as expected, keeps animation state.
https://github.com/IanNMarshall/angular8-animation-example

## üåç  Your Environment
```
Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 12.13.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 
... 
Ivy Workspace: 

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.901.0
@angular-devkit/core         9.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics   9.1.0
@schematics/angular          9.1.0
@schematics/update           0.901.0
rxjs                         6.5.4
```
**Anything else relevant?**
Could not mimic this behavior with [style] binding or setAttribute("style") seems to only happen with animations.

Issues.Title: `class` property not applied to component when Ivy is enabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
I'm not sure

### Is this a regression?
Yes, because Ivy was not present in previous versions

### Description
I'm the main author of an Angular library named `angular-archwizard`.
A few users of the library stumbled over the issue where the newest version of wizard, which has been built using Angular 9, does not seem to work when used in another project using Angular 9 and Ivy deactivated. 

### Ivy off
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18488086/78283547-38c31880-751e-11ea-8efa-453afb4bbd21.png)

### Ivy on
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18488086/78283613-53958d00-751e-11ea-9640-515ba62d0d0f.png)

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular9-archwizard-css?file=tsconfig.json

Flip `enableIvy` to `false` to see that the css classes are not applied anymore

## üî• Exception or Error
```
WARNING: sanitizing unsafe style value [object Object] (see http://g.co/ng/security#xss).
```

In addition it seems like the `class` property of the `aw-wizard-navigation-bar` is not applied correctly. Instead of `horizontal small` it contains `[object Object]` (see also https://github.com/madoar/angular-archwizard/issues/278#issuecomment-607490550).

Maybe the warning and the `class` property issue are connected?

## üåç  Your Environment
Link to the repository hosting `angular-archwizard`: https://github.com/madoar/angular-archwizard

**Anything else relevant?**
I'm not sure whether this is actually a bug in Angular or maybe a misconfiguration of `angular-archwizard`. Independent of this I think it is strange that also the tests of `angular-archwizard` only seem to work with Ivy enabled. If you disable it by adding 

```json
"angularCompilerOptions": {
  "enableIvy": false
}
```

to for example [`tsconfig`](https://github.com/madoar/angular-archwizard/blob/develop/tsconfig.json) a number of tests of `angular-archwizard` are failing as can be seen [here](https://github.com/madoar/angular-archwizard/runs/555130754).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`class` property not applied to component when Ivy is enabled" (#36400)

Issues.Title: fix(core): log error instead of warning for unknown properties and elements
Issues.Body:
**Note:** this is a resubmit of #35798 intended for v10.

Changes the Ivy unknown element/property messages from being logged with `console.warn` to `console.error`. This should make them a bit more visible without breaking existing apps. Furthermore, a lot of folks filter out warning messages in the dev tools' console, whereas errors are usually still shown.

BREAKING CHANGE:
Warnings about unknown elements are now logged as errors. This won't break your app, but it may trip up tools that expect nothing to be logged via `console.error`.

Fixes #35699.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): log error instead of warning for unknown properties and elements" (#36399)

Issues.Title: routerLink broken inside FireWire guarded route
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/fire ### Is this a regression? Not sure, it's the first time I used Firewire ### Description When I use `routerLink` inside a Firewire guarded route and click it I get a warning in console: `Navigation triggered outside Angular zone, did you forget to call 'ngZone.run()'?` Also current route is not removed and new route is added broken (looks like change detection has not kicked in) - I have both routes right under `router-outlet`, ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Not sure how to provide a reproduction since it requires boilerplate, auth token etc. Here's what I have, it's pretty basic: I have 4 routes: landing, login page, main logged in page and a "play" route. And app component which is just `router-outlet`. They are configured like that: ``` const routes: Routes = [ { path: 'welcome', loadChildren: () => import('./components/landing/landing.module').then(m => m.LandingModule), }, { path: 'login', loadChildren: () => import('./components/auth/auth.module').then(m => m.AuthModule), canActivate: [AngularFireAuthGuard], data: {authGuardPipe: () => redirectLoggedInTo([''])}, }, { path: 'play', loadChildren: () => import('./components/play/play.module').then(m => m.PlayModule), canActivate: [AngularFireAuthGuard], data: {authGuardPipe: () => redirectUnauthorizedTo(['welcome'])}, }, { path: '', component: MainComponent, canActivate: [AngularFireAuthGuard], data: {authGuardPipe: () => redirectUnauthorizedTo(['welcome'])}, }, ]; ``` All I have in main component from empty path is this: ``` Play ``` If I remove this part from this route configuration, it starts working properly: ``` canActivate: [AngularFireAuthGuard], data: {authGuardPipe: () => redirectUnauthorizedTo(['welcome'])}, ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

Navigation triggered outside Angular zone, did you forget to call 'ngZone.run()'?
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

9.1.0
@angular/fire - 6.0.0-rc.1
firebase - 7.8.0
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: build: add commit message scope for migration changes
Issues.Body:
This is a proposal commit that adds a separate scope for migration changes.

The motivation is that migrations aren't necessarily always affecting `@angular/core`
(e.g. the `move-document` migration is affecting platform-browser). Migrations are just
stored in the `@angular/core` package in favor of a canonical location when someone
runs `ng update`. Additionally, it rather seems confusing that migration changes are listed
under `core` in the changelog. Long commit message titles are needed to make clear that
commits do _not_ affect `@angular/core` runtime logic, but just the ng update migrations.

On a side note: I'd like to also propose that we add a separate codeowner group for migrations in the future. Reviews for migration changes seem to be slow. Only a subset of `fw-core` reviewers has
dealt with those migrations, and also others like Kristiyan are familiar with migrations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: add commit message scope for migration changes" (#36390)

Issues.Title: update pullapprove config to better handle global approvals
Issues.Body:
Beginning this this change, global approvals will now require the approver
to include `Reviewed-for: global-approvers`, and a docs global approval
requires `Reviewed-for: global-docs-approvers`.

Historically, providing a review by any member of the global reviewer
groups would automatically be considered a global review.  This change
enforces that global approval should be an intentional, explicit action.

The global-approvers and global-docs-approvers group will not be
requested as reviews by pullapprove.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "update pullapprove config to better handle global approvals" (#36384)

Issues.Title: Angular 9 (Ivy) App build with local library (mono-repo) failing
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Haven't tested in older version, so i'm unsure, but considering that this is Ivy related, i would imagine it is regression. ### Description I have an Angular 9 app that i'm starting to move some of the components into a dedicated library project, which uses secondary entry points (trying to mimic Angular Material's approach). Everything builds fine if i build both library and app with the Ivy compiler, but if i build both with the --prod flag (which causes the library to be built without Ivy), the app build fails with the following error: ``` Compiling @fabric/components/breadcrumbs : es2015 as esm2015 ERROR in node_modules/@fabric/components/breadcrumbs/fab-breadcrumbs.module.d.ts:1:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class. This likely means that the library (@fabric/components/breadcrumbs) which declares FabBreadcrumbsModule has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if s o. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy. 1 export declare class FabBreadcrumbsModule { ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ``` I tried updating to the latest version (9.0.2 -> 9.1.0), but it's still doing the same thing. I tried recreating this with a brand new super simple mono-repo project, but in that simple case it works fine. I compared the tsconfig and angular.json config files between my app and the simple working app, but they're fairly identical. As a last resort, i added `"postinstall": "ngcc"` to my root package.json, wiped out my library's folder in my node_modules dir, and re-ran npm install. This forced ngcc to run on everything including my library. After that, the app build worked as it should. So it would seem that the app build isn't recognizing that the library build was done with viewEngine and kicking off the ngcc itself? ## üî• Exception or Error 

Compiling @fabric/components/breadcrumbs : es2015 as esm2015

ERROR in node_modules/@fabric/components/breadcrumbs/fab-breadcrumbs.module.d.ts:1:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class.

This likely means that the library (@fabric/components/breadcrumbs) which declares FabBreadcrumbsModule has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if s
o. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy.

1 export declare class FabBreadcrumbsModule {
                       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Issues.Title: docs: update ng-conf announcement to remove livestream link
Issues.Body:
Since the livestream for ng-conf is not public this year,
(and is only available to ng-conf attendees), we are
removing the link from the angular.io homepage.

Instead, we are now pointing to the ng-conf homepage for
more information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: update ng-conf announcement to remove livestream link" (#36382)

Issues.Title: fix(core): user errors during creation masked by framework errors
Issues.Body:
When we render a view for the first time, we only set the `firstCreatePass` flag on the `TView` after the template function has run. The problem is that if an error is thrown during the first template run, the flag will never be reset so we'll keep executing as if it's the first pass and we'll eventually hit a framework assertion somewhere which masks the user's error. These changes set the flag again after everything is done so that we don't re-run the creation logic again.

Fixes #31221.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): user errors during creation masked by framework errors" (#36381)

Issues.Title: Null pointer exception in transition_animation_engine.ts
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/animations

### Is this a regression?

I'm not sure. If so, it has been around a while.

### Description

I have a component that is able to trigger a null pointer exception on https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/08348fc2e8b48d58a30063b0b5b03d21158a315b/packages/animations/browser/src/render/transition_animation_engine.ts#L376. It seems that the element state is not in the map!

The end result is that an element gets orphaned in the DOM when it is supposed to be removed using an *ngIf.

I hacked up the code to do a silent return if the element state is not present and the problem went away. However, I don't know if this is the proper fix.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Internal Google bug b/152896966 has repro steps (but note that it requires some kind of timing issue / race condition to repro)

## üî• Exception or Error

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'animateMessageStatus' of undefined

angular2/rc/packages/animations/browser/src/render/transition_animation_engine.ts:376:28
```

See b/152896966#comment2 for more


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

Whatever version google3 is currently on.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Null pointer exception in transition_animation_engine.ts" (#36378)

Issues.Title: build: rebuild yarn lock from scratch
Issues.Body:
Rebuild the yarn lock file from scratch to collapse instances where
one package is able to satisfy multiple dependencies.  Currently we
have some situations where we have multiple versions when one would
work.

Example:
```
"@babel/code-frame@^7.0.0":
  version "7.0.0"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-OfC2uemaknXr87bdLUkWog7nYuliM9Ij
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.0.0"

"@babel/code-frame@^7.5.5":
  version "7.5.5"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-27d4lZoomVyo51VegxI20xZPuSHusqbQ
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.0.0"

"@babel/code-frame@^7.8.3":
  version "7.8.3"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-a9gxpmdXtZEInkCSHUJDLHZVBgb1QS0j
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.8.3"
```

becomes

```
"@babel/code-frame@^7.0.0", "@babel/code-frame@^7.5.5", "@babel/code-frame@^7.8.3":
  version "7.8.3"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-a9gxpmdXtZEInkCSHUJDLHZVBgb1QS0j
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.8.3"
```

Additional to this rebuild of the `yarn.lock` file, the generated golden for ng_package is updated as tslib has changed.

Payload sizes for integration tests also changed as a result of these changes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: rebuild yarn lock from scratch" (#36377)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): enable lazy loading on the server for new projects
Issues.Body: With this change, lazy-loading on the server becomes enabled out of the box for new projects. This is because webpack will only split ES6 imports into separate chunks. However when using commonjs all lazy loaded paths will be concatenated into the main.js file.

Issues.Title: ng build --prod changes opacity value of CSS rule on brand new ng new project
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

I don't know.

### Description

When doing ng build --prod, it changes the opacity value of a css rule.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Create a new project:

PS D:\Projects\Test Projects> ng new cssBug
? Would you like to add Angular routing? No
? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? SCSS   [ https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax#scss

Open file /src/styles.scss

Add the following lines in the file:

```
.mat-form-field-appearance-outline.mat-focused .mat-form-field-outline-thick, 
.mat-form-field-appearance-outline.mat-form-field-invalid.mat-form-field-invalid .mat-form-field-outline-thick {
  opacity: 50% !important;
}
```

Build new project:

PS D:\Projects\Test Projects> cd cssBug
PS D:\Projects\Test Projects\cssBug> ng build --prod

Open /dist/cssBug/style.hash.css.

Look at previously inserted lines. 

Result: opacity has been change from 50% !important to 1% !important.
I have reproduced this 3 times.

## üî• Exception or Error

No Exception. The error is a change in the CSS value of opacity.

## üåç Your Environment

PS D:\Projects\Test Projects\cssBug> ng version

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 10.16.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

... router

typescript                        3.8.3

**Anything else relevant?**

Change in CSS rule causes a display issue when going from dev to prod build. Issue is visible across all browsers.

Issues.Title: Karma Plugin Error while running ng test from maven in Angular 6
Issues.Body:
I am using `front end maven plugin` to run unit tests in Angular.
Angular 6 version is being used 
 
Below is the configuration - 

**karma.conf.js :**

    module.exports = function (config) {
      config.set({
        basePath: '',
        frameworks: ['jasmine', '@angular-devkit/build-angular'],
        plugins: [
          require('karma-jasmine'),
          require('karma-chrome-launcher'),
          require('karma-jasmine-html-reporter'),
          require('karma-coverage-istanbul-reporter'),
          require('@angular-devkit/build-angular/plugins/karma')
        ],
        client: {
          clearContext: false browser
        },
        coverageIstanbulReporter: {
          dir: require('path').join(__dirname, '../../coverage'), 
          reports: [ 'html', 'lcovonly', 'text-summary' ],
          fixWebpackSourcePaths: true
        },
        angularCli: {
          environment: 'dev'
        },
        reporters: ['progress', 'kjhtml'],
        port: 9876,
        colors: true,
        logLevel: config.LOG_INFO,
        autoWatch: true,
        browsers: ['Chrome'],
        singleRun: false,
        restartOnFileChange: true,
    	browserNoActivityTimeout: 100000
      });
    };

**pom.xml :** 

    <execution>
    	<id>test</id>
    	<goals>
    			<goal>karma</goal>
    	</goals>
    	<phase>test</phase>
    	<configuration>
    		<karmaConfPath>karma.conf.js</karmaConfPath>
    		<arguments>--code-coverage</arguments>
    	</configuration>
    </execution>


I am getting below error when I run - `mvn clean install` 

Server start failed on port 9876: Error: The `'@angular-devkit/build-angular/plugins/karma'` karma plugin is meant to be used from within Angular CLI and will not work correctly outside of it.

I have researched a bit and found below links but I havent yet found any solution. 
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10703#issuecomment-387319138

Please not that we have to do **this from maven only** 

Can anybody please help here as I am struggling to get this running ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Karma Plugin Error while running ng test from maven in Angular 6" (#17370)

Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
I see that tremendous advancements were already made in the last years, dear Angular Team: Thank you for that!

There is something that I'd like to start a discussion on:

Faster and specific tests.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
- [ x] test

### Description
Looking at just and wallaby.js I really would like to have that by default in Angular when running ng test (in watch mode). 

As I like to keep my applications in standard, I think we all could benefit from improvements like these.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I think the main features are:
- if you change a test, just rerun that specific test
- if you change code, determine which tests are affected and rerun these tests
- if you change code in a spec file other than a specific test, rerun the whole spec
- have a state of tests in memory and show interesting information about it in vs code

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Aquire wallaby.js and integrate it.

Input welcome.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): use TypeScript 3.6
Issues.Body:
When used within the build optimizer, TypeScript 3.8 will consider certain imports to be unreferenced and errantly remove them even though they are used within the module.  This results in runtime errors during application load.  TypeScript 3.7 cannot be used due to it causing a build time error when used within the build optimizer.  The build optimizer uses an independent version of TypeScript which allows it to use TypeScript 3.6 while applications continue to use TypeScript 3.7 or 3.8 to build the actual application.

Fixes: #17320
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): use TypeScript 3.6" (#17364)

The problem also was in NG7. I hoped it would be gone in NG9, but it is still there. ### Description There are lots of warnings when running ng build or ng serve. Issues.Title: "types" not used as a synonym for "typings" in package.json
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No, at least not that I'm aware of. ### Description I'm using a third-party module and that module's package.json file has a "types" attribute instead of "typings." When I do a production build, `ng build --prod`, I get a module resolution error: "Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration." If I manually change "types" to "typings" in the module's package.json, per the [Angular Package Format](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CZC2rcpxffTDfRDs6p1cfbmKNLA6x5O-NtkJglDaBVs/preview#heading=h.k0mh3o8u5hx) then the error goes away. The [TypeScript documentation](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/publishing.html) states that "the 'typings' field is synonymous with 'types.'" ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I've created a StackBlitz that reproduces the issue. I've added one third-party dependency, @stripe/stripe-js, and exposed that modules `loadStripe` method as a provider in `app.module.ts`. - Download the following project from StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-kezmsy?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts - Extract the zip file: `unzip angular-kezmsy.zip` - Install dependencies: `npm i` - Do a production build: `npm run build -- --prod` ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in ./src/app/app.module.ngfactory.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@stripe/stripe-js/types/index' in '/home//Downloads/angular-kezmsy/src/app'
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 7.0.7
Node: 10.16.3
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.2.14
... common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/core              7.0.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.0.7
@angular/cli                      7.0.7
@angular/compiler-cli             7.0.4
@angular/language-service         7.0.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.7
@schematics/angular               7.0.7
@schematics/update                0.10.7
rxjs                              6.5.4
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
**Anything else relevant?** The error also goes away if I remove the `loadStripe` provider that I've added in `app.module.ts`, but that makes it difficult to test. The error did not surface during development, i.e. while service the app via `ng serve`. The error does not crop up during a non-prod build--`npm run build` works fine--so I suspect it has to do with aot. The module that I'm using is @stripe/stripe-js. Here's the package.json file: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/v1.2.0/package.json#L8 Note that on line 8 "types" is used instead of "typings." I asked a question about this on SO and it has some additional context: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60940657/angular-8-and-stripe-js-v3s-loadstripe-module-not-found-error-cant-resolve

Issues.Title: ng build --prod does not generate consistent hashes on different machines when run with same code base
Issues.Body:
### Versions
angular : 8.2 & 9.1
angular-cli: 8.3 & 9.1
OS: windows 7 & 10 64bit

### Repro steps
Create a site with ng new
Add a lazy path with loadChildren
ng build --prod
Use same source code in differnt machine
ng build --prod
compare these two dist with same source code(no change)

### Observed behavior
Same issue occurred in angular V8.2 & 9.1 versions(attached screenshot of differences in hashes for same source code). Currently production build is in angular 8.2
1)	When run in different drives in same machine with same source code, Every time production build happens the hashes in the chunks does not change as no change in the source code ‚Äì working as expected
2)	when run in different computer machine with same source code, production build happens the hashes in the chunks changes when comparing between dist in windows 7 and dist in windows 9 though there is no changes in source code.

### Desired behavior
when run in different computer machine with same source code, Every --prod build should not change the hashes in the chunks  because no change made in existing code base.


what is recommended way to achieve desired behavior? 

if customizing the angular-cli/webpack package is alternate approach, what is the recommended options?

Issues.Title: property shorthand usage for animations cause errors in production build
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build ### Is this a regression? Yes Our code ran without problem with `--prod` build flag in angular 7. But now it fails with the same flag in angular 9 with ivy enabled. ### Description We have some shared `animations` definitions like this: *animations.ts* ```ts import { trigger, transition, style, group, animate } from '@angular/animations'; export const animations = [ trigger('expandIn', [ transition(':enter', [ style({ overflow: 'hidden', height: 0, paddingTop: 0, paddingBottom: 0, marginTop: 0, marginBottom: 0, opacity: 0 }), group([ animate('500ms cubic-bezier(0.23, 1, 0.32, 1)', style({ height: '*', paddingTop: '*', paddingBottom: '*', marginTop: '*', marginBottom: '*', transform: 'translateZ(0)' })), animate('250ms cubic-bezier(0.23, 1, 0.32, 1)', style({ opacity: 1 })) ]) ]), ]), ]; ``` the animations are defined in a separate file `animations.ts`. And then it's referenced like this: ```ts import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { animations } from './animations'; @Component({ selector: 'app-notlazycomp', templateUrl: './notlazycomp.component.html', styleUrls: ['./notlazycomp.component.scss'], animations, // notice this property shorthand syntax }) export class NotLazycompComponent implements OnInit { constructor() { } ngOnInit(): void { } } ``` Those codes look good to me and they works in `Angular 7`. Now with `Angular 9`, the production build will throw runtime error: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5404597/77979305-e247b580-7336-11ea-87b4-6fb169d342b9.png) I have found 3 ways to workaround it: 1. disable ivy with `"enableIvy": false,` 2. set `"optimization": false,` in production configuration (`aot` and `buildOptimizer` can still be `true`) 3. abandon `property shorthand` for `animations` property, just change to `animations: animations` also fixes the problem. We went with option 3 but it looks confusing why valid typescript code doesn't work and the linter even tell me to use `property shorthand`. It's fine to be a compilation error but unacceptable to be a runtime error only. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. clone repo: https://github.com/crysislinux/angular9-prod-build-runtime-error 2. `npm run build` to create production build 3. `http-server dist/angular9-ext -p 4200` 4. visit http://localhost:4200/ You should see some error messages in the console. 5. switch `optimization` from `true` to false in `angular.json` line `43` 6. repeat step `2` to `4` Now it loads without problem. 7. switch `optimization` from `false` to `true` 8. repeat step `2` to `4` Now you should see the problem again 9. edit `src/app/notlazy/notlazycomp/notlazycomp.component.ts`, change line 8 from `animations,` to `animations: animations,` 10. repeat step `2` to `4` Now it loads without problem. Turn off ivy also fix the problem but I have a lazy load route in the repo so it may not work. By the way, this problem also breaks the lazy loading if there is the same `animations` property shorthand usage in the lazy loaded module. ## üî• Exception or Error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5404597/77979305-e247b580-7336-11ea-87b4-6fb169d342b9.png) ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 10.16.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.0
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.0
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.0
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.0
@schematics/angular               9.1.0
@schematics/update                0.901.0
rxjs                              6.5.4
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?** N/A

Issues.Title: bug([moment-date-adapter]): MomentDateAdapter not guarding against `undefined` locale
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Using the `MomentDateAdapter` and setting up the locale as `undefined` leads to an error. Calling `this._adapter.setLocale(undefined)` is not throwing an exception. When the `MomentDateAdapter` calls `createDate()`, it specifically calls:

`const result = this._createMoment({year, month, date}).locale(this.locale);`

Since `this.locale` is `undefined`, the `locale()` method of moment acts as a getter, thus returning a default locale such as `en`.

The `MomentDateAdapter` further checks for

`if (!result.isValid())`

which is failing, because the method `.isValid()` does not exist for type `string`.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

`setLocale()` should guard against an `undefined` value, or the `createDate()` method should deal with this unexpected behavior more gracefully.

#### Actual Behavior

`MomentDateAdapter` initialization fails with `ERROR TypeError: result.isValid is not a function`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([moment-date-adapter]): MomentDateAdapter not guarding against `undefined` locale " (#18971)

Issues.Title: fix(google-maps): not rendering until mapTypeId is set
Issues.Body:
In 2a6aae179a436886395cc8ecc631f7c7be4dff24 I added the ability to set the `mapTypeId` and after I was done with it and ran the unit tests, I added a default of `undefined` to the `DEFAULT_OPTIONS` so the tests didn't have to be updated. It looks like having the `undefined` in the defaults causes Google Maps not to render anything in the map until the map type changes. These changes remove the default value and update the tests instead.

Fixes #18965.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(google-maps): not rendering until mapTypeId is set" (#18967)

Issues.Title: bug([google-map]): [README.MD example only produces grey rectangle, no map]
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

The README for Google Maps contains code that produces just a grey map:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/google-maps/README.md

Steps to reproduce:
 Add the readme code to a brand new simple new demo project (ng new demo)  
 
#### Expected Behavior
The map should be displayed correctly, without having to force a refresh. 

#### Actual Behavior
A grey rectangle is displayed where the map should be. 
No error messages are produced. 
Note the README example did work correctly for Google Maps in Angular Components 9.0. 

With Google-Maps in Angular Components 9.2, to get a map correctly displayed, one now needs to add this extra line to the demo .html file:
            [mapTypeId]="mapTypeId"
And add this line to the demo .ts file:
mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId;
and also implement AfterViewInit to force a redraw:
export class GoogleMapDemo implements AfterViewInit {
..
ngAfterViewInit(): void {
// Vary the map properties somehow to force a redraw
    this.mapTypeId = google.maps.MapTypeId.ROADMAP;
  }
}

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 83.0.4093.3
- Operating System: Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([google-map]): [README.MD example only produces grey rectangle, no map]" (#18965)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-experimental:DIALOG): Config option disableClose does not work with openFromTemplate
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

While using the dialog to open a template by calling `openFromTemplate`, the `disableClose` is not respected. When you use a component by calling `openFromComponent`, the `disableClose` does work.

Most likely cause:

Inside [`_attachDialogContentForComponent`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/8a712884701e05c88dfc4358c3f3ffc44c42f6d3/src/cdk-experimental/dialog/dialog.ts#L235) there is a 
```
dialogRef.disableClose = config.disableClose;
```

This is missing in the [` _attachDialogContentForTemplate`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/8a712884701e05c88dfc4358c3f3ffc44c42f6d3/src/cdk-experimental/dialog/dialog.ts#L252)

#### Expected Behavior

That the dialog doesn't close on Escape key if `disableClose` is true

#### Actual Behavior

It closes when it shouldn't :(

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK-experimental: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-experimental:DIALOG): Config option disableClose does not work with openFromTemplate" (#18964)

Issues.Title: Enable tree-shaking of more services
Issues.Body:
This branch is an attempt to improve tree-shaking of several services.

I started by removing the services that are `providedIn: 'root'` from the `providers` of any module, as that should not be needed and actually prevents them from being removed by tree-shaking.

I am investigating whether the remaining services (such as `MatDialog` and `Overlay`) need to be provided explicitly or if they can also become tree-shakable.

This branch aims at fixing https://github.com/angular/components/issues/11581 and https://github.com/angular/components/issues/18944
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable tree-shaking of more services" (#18962)

Issues.Title: build: resolve module names in circular deps test
Issues.Body:
Currently the circular dependencies test only resolves
relative imports. It does not resolve module names
to packages/entry-points which are part of the Angular
Components repository.

To ensure that such repo-specific module names are resolved, we
add a custom module resolver. This helps us making the circular deps
test future-proof in case an entry-point uses module names.

Within an entry-point circular dependencies could be also created
with module name imports.

@josephperrott Sorry. I would have commented on the original PR, but I didn't have a chance to have anther look as the PR still had `merge ready` applied and got merged quickly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: resolve module names in circular deps test" (#18957)

Issues.Title: bug(MAT-TABLE): Error inside mat-table crashes the error handler mat dialog component
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-table-and-error-handler

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the StackBlitz sample and you will see a mat-dialog without content and in the console, you will also be able to see only the dialog constructor was called.
2. In the app.component.ts you can see what is causing the error. In the "tableConfiguration" property, we have a duplicated column definition.
3. You can fix that removing the duplicated column definition and you could see the error handler dialog properly displaying another error and the complete lifecycle of the error handler dialog component is printed to the console.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
I was expecting to have my error handler dialog component to be shown correctly even if the error occurs inside a mat-table.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
If I have an error inside a mat-table, the error handler dialog component will crash.

#### Environment

The WCAG 2.1 standard will go into effect June 30, 2020. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? Latest, all browsers. #### Is there anything else we should know? Thank you

Issues.Title: bug([mat-autocomplete]): jasmine test: There is no directive with "exportAs" set to "matAutocomplete"

Mat Autocomplete failed some otherwise working tests: ``` ]#autoAuthSignatory="matAutocomplete"> Error: Template parse errors: There is no directive with "exportAs" set to "matAutocomplete" (" [formControl]="attentionControl"> ]#autoAttention="matAutocomplete"> ``` Code causing the issue: ``` Attention {{contact.name}} | {{contact.position}} search
Authorized Signatory {{contact.name}} | {{contact.position}} search ``` #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.4 - CDK/Material: 9.2.0 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS Mojave 10.14.5

Issues.Title: bug(MatSelectionList): Last selected mat-list-option is shown when clicking on mat-list-item outside of the view
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-f96lhr-swa9hp

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select and/or deselect a list option
2. Scroll down so the option isn't visible anymore
3. Click a list item
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Nothing should really happen, all items should stay in place and scroll shouldn't move


#### Actual Behavior

Content is scrolled upwards so that the last selected list option is visible
Note: if the list option is already visible - nothing happens and this is correct behavior


#### Environment

- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material: 9
- Browser(s):Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, macOs, Linux (at least Void Linux)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatSelectionList): Last selected mat-list-option is shown when clicking on mat-list-item outside of the view" (#18948)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): previousIndex is not correct if list contains invisible items
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rs1rtm

move "Go home" item into "Done" list

Steps to reproduce:
1. Define two drag-drop lists
2. Add both visible and invisible (display: none) items into lists
3. Drag'n'Drop some items from one list into another
4. Sometimes wrong (invisible) item is moved (depending on an item position) (on cdkDropListDropped `event.previousIndex` of a selected item is not an actual index in the list of items but index of only visible items in this list)
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Correct (visible) item which was selected should be moved into list (on cdkDropListDropped `event.previousIndex` must be an index of an item in a list regardless of visibility)


#### Actual Behavior

On cdkDropListDropped `event.previousIndex` of a selected item is not an actual index in the list of items but index of only visible items in this list


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.1.0-9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149 (but I think it reproducible in all browsers) 
- Operating System: macOS (but I think it reproducible in all OS)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): previousIndex is not correct if list contains invisible items" (#18947)
